comments.raw_text:
User Agent: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; WOW64; rv:9.0a1) Gecko/20110909 Firefox/9.0a1
Build ID: 20110909030839

Steps to reproduce:

Firefox 9 scores too low as compare to other browser in "contenteditable" (Rich Text Editor test).
Test URL: http://www.browserscope.org/richtext2/test

Some breakdown scores with FF9 Nightly:
                                                                     scored/out of
Selection:                                                             90/114
Apply format:                                                         28/31
Apply format, styleWithCSS:                                     12/18
Change format:                                                       14/32
Change format, styleWithCSS:                                   1/27
Unapply format:                                                       26/80
Unapply format, styleWithCSS:                                   32/46
Delete Content:                                                       34/52
Forward-Delete Content:                                           5/49
Insert Content:                                                        28/37
Selection Results:                                                     130/372
q.C Support Function:                                                42/48
q.C Enabled Function:                                                38/46
q.C Indeterm Function:                                               19/46
q.C State Function:                                                    49/88
q.C State Function, styleWithCSS:                                75/88
q.C Value Function:                                                    15/67
q.C Value Function, styleWithCSS:                                 31/67




Actual results:

1. Open URL
2. Run Test
3. FF9 Nightly score just 669 (FF8 scores just 611)


Expected results:

Firefox should do better....
comments.creator: zlip.792@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: We're aware of this.  In fact we run this test suite continuously at Mozilla.  However, at this point we are not sure that these test results necessarily reflect our desired goals, so we are not planning to optimize for getting higher points here.
comments.creator: ehsan.akhgari@gmail.com

comments.raw_text: Considering comment 1, can the status of this bug be changed accordingly (as won't fix)?

comments.text: Some of the tests are uninteresting, and some are wrong, but a lot of them point out legitimate areas where Gecko should change.  I've been thinking we could use a tracking bug for this -- I've written a whole bunch of patches lately that fix richtext2 tests.  (My patched Gecko is at around 718/1308, as opposed to around 671 for someone's 13.0a2.)  I do think some of them aren't important, though -- do we really need a createBookmark command?
comments.author: ayg@aryeh.name
comments.creator: ayg@aryeh.name
